name: 75th Street Brewery
description:
75th Street Brewery is Kansas City’s first and best brewpub that opened its doors in 1993.  Located in the historic Waldo district, the Brewery is home to live, local music (including Kansas City’s own Brew Jam every Sunday, and live Bluegrass music every Wednesday).

The Brewery boasts award-winning hand-crafted beers (fresh growlers to go every day) and a made-from-scratch menu. 75th Street Brewery has received local, regional, and national awards and accolades, including the 1999 Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup for the Red-Eye Rye Beer.

75th Street Brewery features beers brewed from the great traditions of England, Germany, Ireland, and Czechoslovakia. We also offer special seasonal styles with influences from around the globe. Each of our beers is produced from the finest barley and hops in the world and includes only four basic ingredients: Barley, Hops, Yeast, and Water. No additives or preservatives are used. Because our beers are handcrafted in small batches and kept cold, no preservatives or pasteurization are required. You are guaranteed a fresh and natural pint of beer every time. Cheers!

name: American River Brewing
description: American River Brewing was formerly known as Brewers of Auburn and was sold to Hoppy Brewing before the Oatmeal Stout was brewed.

name: Avery Brewing Company
description: Since 1993 our brewery has been committed to producing eccentric ales and lagers that defy styles or categories. Our products are thoroughly American at heart: blending Old World tradition and expertise with ingenuity, creativity and boldness.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Avery Tap Room Hours: 11AM to 11PM - 7 days a week.
Brewery Tours are at 4PM weekdays and 2PM on weekends.

name: Bays Brewery
description:
Welcome to Bays Brewery and its wide range of quality Beers, Ciders and Real Tasty Drinks (RTD’s). In landing on this page you have proved to have a passion for true hand crafted beverages and we thank you. Bays has a long history of making quality products dating back to 1993. Located in the Sunshine Capital of New Zealand, Bays make some of finest beer around. Step into Bays Brewery and experience a piece of Nelson, New Zealand. If it is fun you seek, you have found it here. Kia Ora.

Cheers from the Crew at Bays Brewery!

name: Bluegrass Brewing Company
description: The original Bluegrass Brewing Company opened in 1993 at this location, 3929 Shelbyville Road, near Westport Rd., & Chenoweth, & Breckenridge Lanes. It is the city's oldest remaining brewpub and was the first to make a significant mark on the national brewpub and microbrewery scene. Louisville's best beer is made at this location, and large glass windows in the back dining room allow you to witness the brewing operation. The headbrewer is Jerry Gnagy, assisted by Sam Cruz and Cody Mingus.

name: Borgfelder Landhaus
description: The secret of brewing is with us no secret. Discover for yourself the craft brewing, with your Borgfelder Urtrüb and Lilienthaler Dark is brewed for you. Can you smell the fresh beer, with its distinctive flavor during its development process in good company and pleasant Atmosphäre.Lassen But once you invite by our master brewer in the country house and see how the delicious Borgfelder thrives Urtrüb & Lilienthal dark! friendship as a sign of tradition and commitment. Artisanal brewing in connection with the delights of German cooking. here experienced the restaurant a new dimension. In our house you can align weddings, parties, corporate events and other events! A very special experience! We offer plenty of space for celebrations of any kind in our spacious room with a pleasant ambience. Let us spoil you with typical country house quality to this day for you and your guests will remember always. Talk to us so that we can work with you to plan a festive event.

name: Brown's Brewing Company
description:
Back in 1993, Garry and Kelly Brown had a vision to turn a 150 year-old warehouse on a then-blighted River Street in Troy into a fully operational craft brewery. The building was previously owned by a local printing company and had been gutted by a massive fire and the project took three painstaking years to complete. However, the endeavor was well worth it as Brown’s Brewing Company became an instant success as the first brewery restaurant in the Capital Region.

Today, our River Street Taproom in Troy, New York is a social hub for the community and offers a menu that compliments the beer we brew on site. We brew over 25 different styles of ales and lagers throughout the year and serve over a dozen beers on tap at any one time. Our dependable ales and lagers are also available in bottles at home or on draft in select taverns and restaurants throughout the Capital Region.

name: Colorado Boy Pub & Brewery
description:
Colorado Boy is owned and operated by Tom & Sandy Hennessy (Pictured at right) who have been in the brewing business since 1993, starting with IL Vicino in Albuquerque, Colorado Springs, and Salida, Colorado, and the Palisade Brewery in Palisade, Colorado.

Since 1993, Tom has been pushing the idea of Frankenbrew and publishd a video on how to build inexpensive brewing systems in 1995. Colorado Boy is the culmination of years of owning and operating different breweries. Stop by and see how small and efficient Frankenbrew works.

name: Davidson Brothers Restaurant & Brewery
description:
"We’re not real fancy, we believe in great food, exceptional beer and having a good time. Honestly, it’s why we went into business. We’d never owned a restaurant and had no idea how to brew beer, but we were experienced beer tasters and knew plenty about going out to eat.
Granted, this isn’t the salesiest pitch, but we let the food, beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. We stick to the beer guarantee and greeting our guests."

name: Erie Brewing Company
description: Erie Brewing Co. is a microbrewery that offers award winning craft beers to the Erie community and along the East Coast. You can stop in for a tasting and tour or find one of our 10 beers at your local bar, 6 pack shop, or beer distributor.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Wed - Fri:	12:00 pm - 5:00 pm
Sat:	1:00 pm - 4:00 pm

name: Fish Brewing Company
description: From our home in beautiful Olympia, Washington, Fish Brewing Company has been hand-crafting ales of Northwest proportions since 1993. Then, using a system cobbled from brewing and dairy equipment, we brewed for our neighbors up and down Puget Sound. Growing steadily since, Fish is now an award-winning craft brewer with distribution throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond.

name: Flying Goose Brewpub
description:
The Flying Goose Brew Pub & Grille is a family run restaurant that carries over 15 handcrafted brews on tap as well as an extensive menu offering many options to satisfy the whole family!

We strive to provide the best service and most enjoyable experience for any occasion; whether it be a quick lunch, a refreshing beer, or a nice dinner... we are ready to serve up just what you've been craving.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Sat: 11:30 am - 9:00 pm
Sun: 11:30 am - 8:00 pm

name: Golden Valley Brewery
description:
Best Brew Pub in the Heart of Wine Country!

Since we started in 1993, we've followed a fresh, local, made-in-house cuisine program at Golden Valley.

We've always had our own kitchen garden supplying the restaurant, and sourced fresh vegetables, fruits, meat, fish and poultry from local producers whenever possible.

Our chef Greg Meixner orchestrates the procurement of fresh, healthy, great tasting foods for you and your family.

Everyone knows the rich, fresh and natural taste of our beef but few realize how we do it.

Since 2003, GVB owners Peter & Celia Kircher have also owned and operated the Angus Springs Ranch on 76 acres of rolling spring fed pastures outside McMinnville.

Golden Valley Brewery grain makes ideal feed for our select Black Angus herd because it contains twice the protein and fiber of regular feed. 

Our Angus are raised on an all natural program of spring fed pastures and premium rations for up to 12 months and then dry aged for 21 days insuring beef of exceptional quality and tenderness.

No hormones, antibiotic feeds, or animal by products are used in the production of our beef. 

Our goal is to produce the finest all natural beef in the Northwest!

name: Grand Rapids Brewing Company
description:
In December of 1993, exactly one hundred years from the time of its original inception, the doors were open to the historically themed Grand Rapids Brewing Co. Now over a decade old, you can say that the Grand Rapids Brewing Co. has existed in three centuries: 1800s, 1900s, and the current century.

Enthusiasts continue to bring in glasses, pictures, and artifacts from the turn-of-the century brewery. One woman found half of the original sign that hung on the Ionia and Michigan Street building—as she was cleaning her great uncle's inherited barn. The sign was facing down and being used as a shelf.

In a different incident, the brewery was called by archeologists digging at a Michigan training camp for soldiers during the Spanish-American War. There, in what must have been their trash, were dozens of empty Silver Foam bottles.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Sun - Thurs: 11:00 am - 12:00 am
Fri & Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

name: Jasper Murdock's Alehouse / The Norwich Inn
description: In 1993, this Vermont brewery tradition was revived at the Norwich Inn when Jasper Murdock's Alehouse began producing traditional English-style ales in 5-gallon glass jugs. By 1995, an historic livery building was renovated and outfitted with a new four-barrel brew house, enabling 125-gallon batches. Though the vessels are now larger, we remain one of the smallest breweries in America.

name: Lagunitas Brewing Company
description:
From our earliest days of striving to make consistently good beer, and instead making beer that ranged from vile, to barely drinkable, to wonderful, to elegant, to questionable-at-best. From being castigated by our West Marin neighbors to finally suffering an 'eviction' by our West Marin septic system. From landing in the welcoming arms of Petaluma, and actually getting our beer into bottles, onto the streets, and into the hands of sympathatic beer geeks, to steadily losing less money each month. From all this and more, Lagunitas Brewing Company is emerging as a battle-tested brewery capable of making great beer out of goat's milk, brambles, and asphalt on the surface of the Moon, if need be.

As the poet once said, 'Where, but for the grace of God and the kindness of strangers, go I'. Where go we indeed, whatever that means.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Wed thru Friday 3:00-9:00.
Sat & Sun: 1:00-7:00

name: Left Hand Brewing Company
description: Left Hand Brewing Company has been brewing world class, award winning beers since its founding in 1993. They see their beers as a wonderful liquid food to complement meals and social occasions. They strive for the perfect balance and harmony between malt and hops in every beer, from a golden crisp Polestar Pilsner to a roasty, black Wake Up Dead Imperial Stout,  —allowing a truly unique and flavorful with every glass.

name: Mac & Jacks Brewing Company
description: Mac & Jack’s Brewing Company proudly dedicates itself to preserving a clean environment as a responsible resident in Redmond and to the community at large. From re-using water to providing spent grain to local farmers, all byproducts created here during the brewing process are recycled responsibly. This makes for happy neighbors as well as happy cows!

name: Mountain Sun Pub & Brewery
description: "Hippies, mountain bikers, and locals flock here for some of Boulder's best microbrews. The low-priced, healthy fare includes massive mixed-green salads, big burritos and even non-garden-variety burgers, like the Black and Blue burger, with blue cheese and blackened seasoning. The Junk burger is loaded with everything in the kitchen. Drink options include the coffee-alcohol Java Porter, or the XXX Pale Ale, a hoppy brew with flavor and bite."

name: New Glarus Brewing Company
description: Welcome to our quaint little brewery nestled on the outskirts of New Glarus, Wisconsin. The brewery is run by an enthusiastic couple, Daniel & Deb Carey, who have successfully combined business management and brewing professionalism. Our philosophy is based on individuality, cooperation and the employment of 100% natural ingredients to produce world -class, handcrafted beers for our friends in Wisconsin. Cheers!

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Gift Shop / Tours / Tastings: Monday - Sunday 10:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Office Hours: Monday - Friday 9:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.

name: No-Li Brewhouse
description:
If Spokane were a liquid it would most certainly be our beer. Born & Raised in Washington’s Inland Empire, we’re an internationally award-winning brewery, crafting Spokane-Style beers with No Boundaries: innovative beers made in Spokane, by Spokane residents, using ingredients sourced from within 300 miles of Spokane. We create beers that push ourselves & No-Li drinkers beyond the boundaries… taking a leap beyond the typical beer-drinking experience, and into a memorable adventure. No Boundaries, No-Li!

The pub features Inland Northwest-style pub food, with an emphasis on "keeping it local." Most of the dishes are created from scratch, and use as many locally sourced ingredients as possible. 

For more information about our beers, brewery & the pub, visit www.nolibrewhouse.com.

locations.name: Main Brewery

Mon - Thu: 11:00 am - 10:00 pm
Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 11:00 pm
Sun: 11:00 am - 9:00 pm

name: Oak Creek Brewing Company
description:
The Kraus family came to Sedona in 1993 with all their worldly goods and a dream, to brew great fresh beer the way Fred learned at the Gasthausbrauerei Hufeisen, or Horseshoe Brewery, in the picturesque village of Pottenstein, Germany. The dream became reality when they opened the doors of Oak Creek Brewing Co. in west Sedona.

Since February 1995 Sedona's only Microbrewery has been known to locals and tourists alike as the place to enjoy delicious handcrafted brews in a relaxed, unique setting.

name: Palmetto Brewing Company
description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us? We are open five days a week, closed on Sundays and Mondays unless you're interested in stopping by for Bendy Brewski Yoga!

Hours are:
Tues/Wed 3pm - 7pm
Thursday 3pm - 9pm
Fri/Sat 1pm - 9pm

Tours are free and are offered on the hour!

Sun:  1:00pm - 5:00pm

Tours are offered every hour, on the hour. Walk-ins only. If you are interested in a private tour, please email us to schedule.

name: Phantom Canyon Brewing Company
description:
The Phantom Canyon Brewing Company opened in December 1993, after almost three years in the planning. Phantom Canyon is located in the historic Cheyenne Building, which was built in 1901. Originally the local offices of the Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railroad, the building was renovated in 1909 and re-opened as The Cheyenne Hotel (owned and operated by the Shafer family until 1963).

The Cheyenne Building was the first downtown restaurant to be placed on the National Register of Historical Places and is located on the first corner of the city. All addresses and street plans originate from the intersection of Pikes Peak and Cascade. The building is named after Cheyenne Mountain and Chief Two Moons of the Cheyenne Indian Tribe (whose stone visage looks over the front entrance).about image About PCBC

Our second floor boasts the most elegant billiard hall in Colorado Springs. The Phantom Canyon Billiard Hall opened in June 1996 and contains 13 pool tables, an entertaining jukebox, foosball tables, dart boards and big-screen TVs. It’s a popular destination for both the Happy Hour crowd and late night joy seekers. Late night specials and promotions complete the Billiard Hall ambience.

Our third floor Banquet Hall is the perfect place to host private parties or business gatherings. The hall was newly restored and opened December of 2001. It features rows of arched windows with gorgeous mountain views. Wood flooring and 12 foot high ceilings create an elegant space that can accommodate groups of 20- 170 guests. The Banquet Hall contains a full bar and kitchen which cater exclusively to third floor events. Reservations and bookings are arranged through our Banquet Director.

name: Pratt Street Ale House
description: Oliver Breweries was established in 1993, the brewing equipment being imported from the U.K., with the aim of creating authentic English Ales. Our hand crafted ales are brewed with imported malt and hops using a traditional single infusion mash technique and open fermentation with English Ringwood Ale Yeast.

name: Rapscallion Ales
description:
Reducing our dependency on foreign ale...One pint at a time.

Increase awareness about the importance of choosing local. Support local farms, organizations, and charities. Grow the local, independent beer industry one customer at a time.

Local only. Draft only. We focus solely on local restaurants and bars. We only distribute within 200 miles of the brewery. The end.

name: Red Brick Brewing Company
description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

name: San Diego Brewing
description:
We are a multi-tap brew pub, pouring 8-10 house brews along with 40 guest brews.  We offer a pub style menu to accompany our great tap list. 
We offer the NFL, MLB and NBA sports viewing with a multitude of large screen tv's.

name: Sea Dog Brewing Company
description: Today, Sea Dog Brewing Company operates brew pubs in two locations. The Sea Dog in Topsham occupies a scenic spot on the Androscoggin River. The Bangor location overlooks the historic Penobscot River. Both locations serve a full menu of handcrafted ales and creative pub fare with a flair. Being authentic is important to us. Our beers are brewed in a traditional style using only the highest quality ingredients like imported English two-row malted barley and British top-fermenting yeast. Our English brewing style results in brews with a distinctive, refreshing taste and crisp finish unique to top-fermented beers.

name: Syracuse Suds Factory
description:
The Syracuse Suds Factory was founded on January 19th, 1993. It is located in the historic Amos Building in downtown Syracuse, New York. The Syracuse Suds Factory became the first commercial brewery in Syracuse after 31 years. Our first beer was brewed on March 20, 1993 and first tapped on April 17, 1993. At this time we were the only brewery in Syracuse, New York.

The Syracuse Suds Factory also has the claim of being the first brewery, in Syracuse New York, in 31 years to commercially ship its product to other outlets. On May 7th 1995 we shipped our first keg to Jack London's, a pub in Sidney New York. From that point on we have shipped to other accounts outside of Syracuse as well as local accounts.

name: Trafalgar Brewing Company
description: The Trafalgar Brewing Company (TBC) was founded by Mike and Nancy Arnold and George Hengstman in August 1993. For ten years TBC steadily built a reputation as a craft brewery specializing in uniquely brewed small batches of beer. In 2003, with the hugely successful introduction of three flavors of Mead to the Ontario market, TBC changed to Trafalgar Ales & Meads and is now recognized as one of Ontario’s most progressive small breweries.

name: Uinta Brewing Company
description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.
